stray.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to move away from the place you should be
stray.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Three of the soldiers strayed into enemy territory.
stray.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to begin to deal with or think about a different subject from the main one, without intending to
stray.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: This meeting is beginning to stray from the point.
Weâ€™re straying into ethnic issues here.
stray.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if your eyes stray, you begin to look at something else, usually without intending to
stray.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Her eyes strayed to the clock.
stray.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to start doing something that is wrong or immoral, when usually you do not do this
stray.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a stray animal, such as a dog or cat, is lost or has no home
stray.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: accidentally separated from other things of the same kind
stray.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: One man was hit by a stray bullet and taken to hospital.
stray.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: an animal that is lost or has no home
stray.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: someone or something that has become separated from others of the same kind
